title: Implement health and death system
description:
Add health tracking and death mechanics with PERMANENT LOSS.

- Health bar UI for local player
- Visual health indicators for other players (size/color/glow?)
- Death triggers respawn as single-cell at random location
- Reset all progress on death (permanent loss)
- Death visual effect (dissolve/explode into particles?)
- Respawn location logic (avoid spawning in hazards)

Required before implementing combat or enemies.

title: Implement black hole hazards
description:
Create major environmental hazards - black holes with gravity wells.

Visual: Dark void with particle accretion disk
Mechanics:
- 2-3 black holes in world for testing
- Gravity field pulls players toward center
- Pull strength increases closer to center
- Instant death at center point
- Escape possible with effort at outer edges
- High risk/reward: place nutrients near black holes?

Requires health/death system.

title: Implement distortion obstacles
description:
Create static environmental hazards - spatial distortions in the digital grid.

Visual: Warped grid sections, glitch effects
Mechanics:
- Static placement in world (10-15 distortions)
- Collision deals damage
- Visual warning (distortion field, particles)
- Maybe add disorientation effect (inverted controls briefly?)

Requires health system.

title: Choose tech stack for lo-fi MMORPG
description:
Decide on client/server stack. Needs to be:
- Fast to iterate on
- Good for real-time multiplayer (websockets)
- Simple rendering for 2D
- Something you'll enjoy working with

Consider: Node.js + Canvas/Pixi? Python + Pygame? Rust + Bevy? Keep it simple.
notes: Running experiment: Install Rust/Bevy and build minimal test (moving squares) to get felt experience. 1-2 hour timebox to decide if we continue or pivot.

title: Build basic server that handles connections and game state
description:
Server needs to:
- Accept websocket connections
- Track connected players
- Maintain world state
- Broadcast updates to all clients
- Handle player input (movement)

title: Implement entropy swarms (virus enemies)
description:
Create the first enemy type - chaotic entropy swarms that patrol and attack players.

Visual: Glitching, corrupted particle clusters
Behavior:
- Spawn at fixed locations (3-5 swarms for testing)
- Patrol zones or random walk
- Chase players who enter detection radius
- Deal damage on collision (continuous while touching)
- Move slower than players (avoidable with skill)

Requires health system to deal damage to players.

title: Set up TypeScript/Phaser/Node.js project structure
description:
Create clean project structure with:
- Client: TypeScript + Phaser for rendering
- Server: Node.js + Socket.io for multiplayer
- Shared: Common types/constants
- Build tooling for development and production
Make it readable and well-organized.

title: Add one 'game' element for demo juice
description:
Something beyond just walking and talking. Could be:
- Collectible items
- Simple combat/tag
- Building/placing objects
- Emotes/gestures
- Anything that creates emergent moments

Keep it simple but demo-able.

title: Create minimal world/map
description:
Start with something simple - maybe just a small area with some boundaries.
Could be a single room, small town, or abstract space.
Lo-fi aesthetic - doesn't need to be pretty, just functional and charming.
design:
**GODCELL - Digital Primordial Soup**

Game concept: Players are cyber-cells evolving toward transcendence/godhood.

First world aesthetic:
- Digital "water" - flowing data streams and particles
- Tron meets microscopic life
- Dark void with glowing neon elements
- Grid-like structure but organic/flowing
- Particles representing data nutrients
- Players as glowing cyber-cells (circles, not squares)

Visual elements to implement:
- Flowing particle background system
- Grid or flowing line pattern
- Change player rendering to circular cells
- Glowing/pulsing effects
- Ambient data streams flowing past

title: Implement AI/bot players for multiplayer testing
description:
Add AI-controlled players (bots) to test multiplayer dynamics and resource competition before real multiplayer sessions.

**Purpose:**
- Feel what it's like with multiple players competing
- Test nutrient scarcity and competition mechanics
- Observe emergent territorial behavior
- Validate that stage 1 gameplay is fun with competition

**Bot Behaviors:**
- Movement: Navigate the world (simple pathfinding or random walk?)
- Nutrient collection: Seek and collect nearby nutrients
- Collision avoidance: Don't clump up or get stuck
- Evolution: Should bots evolve if they collect enough nutrients?
- Visual distinction: Clearly identifiable as bots vs human players

**Initial Scope:**
- Start with 3-5 bots for testing
- Simple AI is fine - they don't need to be smart, just active
- Server-side simulation (same as real players from client perspective)

**Open Questions:**
- How sophisticated should the AI be? (simple seeking vs strategic?)
- Should bots interact with entropy swarms?
- Do bots fight back if we add combat?
- Should there be a toggle to enable/disable bots?

title: Design and implement proper death/respawn flow
description:
Currently when a player dies, the camera stops tracking them and the game state is unclear. Need to properly design the death/respawn experience.

**Current Bug:**
- After death, camera doesn't follow the player anymore
- No clear feedback about what happened
- No explicit respawn mechanism

**Desired Flow:**
- Player dies (health reaches zero or starvation)
- Show Death UI screen with:
  - Death message/stats (how did you die? how long did you survive? nutrients collected?)
  - Respawn button
  - Maybe: death animation/transition (dilution effect from design doc?)
- Player clicks Respawn
- Respawn as single-cell at random location
- Camera tracks new player entity
- All progress reset (back to stage 1)

**Design Questions:**
- Should there be a respawn delay/timer?
- Show death statistics? (time survived, nutrients collected, stage reached?)
- Should camera show the death location for a moment before UI?
- Spectate mode option instead of immediate respawn?
- Does the dilution death visual from the design doc happen before or during the UI?

**Technical:**
- Death UI component (overlay)
- Proper cleanup of old player entity
- Camera re-attachment to new player entity
- Server-side respawn handling

title: Build basic client with rendering and input
description:
Client needs to:
- Connect to server via websocket
- Render simple 2D world
- Handle keyboard/mouse input
- Send player actions to server
- Display other players

title: Implement player movement and synchronization
description:
Players can move around and see each other move in real-time.
Handle basic networking concerns (latency, prediction, etc.)

title: Implement projectile weapon system
description:
Add energy-based projectile weapons unlocked at Cyber-Organism stage.

Mechanics:
- Unlocked at stage 3 (Cyber-Organism)
- Fire with spacebar or mouse click
- Projectile travels in straight line
- Deals damage on hit to players or enemies
- Cooldown between shots (0.5s for testing)
- Visual: glowing energy bolt matching player color
- Server-authoritative hit detection

Requires health system and progression system (stage gating).

title: Implement nutrient collection system
description:
Create floating data packet nutrients that players can collect by touching them.

- Limited spawns across the world (start with ~20-30 for testing)
- Distinct visual from background particles (maybe hexagonal data crystals?)
- Active pickup on collision
- Respawn after collection (30s cooldown for testing)
- Track player's collected nutrient count
- Visual feedback on collection (particle effect, sound)

This is foundational - needed for progression system.

title: Implement evolution progression system
description:
Create the evolution stage system that tracks player progress.

Evolution stages:
1. Single-Cell (starting) - 20px radius
2. Multi-Cell (10 nutrients) - 30px radius, faster
3. Cyber-Organism (25 nutrients) - 40px radius, projectile weapon
4. Humanoid (50 nutrients) - 50px radius, advanced abilities
5. Godcell (100 nutrients) - endgame form

Mechanics:
- Track current stage and evolution points (EP)
- Nutrient collection grants 1 EP
- Automatic evolution when threshold reached
- Visual transformation on evolution
- Update player size, speed, abilities based on stage
- Broadcast evolution events to other players
- UI showing current stage and progress to next

Depends on nutrient system.

title: Create death UI overlay with stats and respawn button
description:
Design and implement the UI overlay that appears when a player dies.

**UI Components:**
- Full-screen overlay (semi-transparent dark background?)
- Death message/title ("You have diluted into the digital ocean" or similar)
- Statistics display:
  - Time survived
  - Nutrients collected
  - Evolution stage reached
  - Cause of death (starvation, entropy, combat, etc.)
- Respawn button (primary action)
- Maybe: death quote/flavor text that changes each time

**Visual Design:**
- Should fit the digital/glitch aesthetic of the game
- Clear, readable text
- Prominent respawn button
- Optional: subtle particle effects or animation

**Interaction:**
- Show automatically when player dies
- Respawn button sends respawn request to server
- UI dismisses on respawn
- Maybe: ESC key also triggers respawn? Or separate close?

**Technical:**
- Phaser UI overlay scene or DOM elements?
- Receive death event from server with stats
- Hook into respawn flow
- Clean camera tracking state on respawn

**Integration:**
- Part of the overall death/respawn flow (godcell-hyx)
- Should work with dilution death animation when that's implemented

title: Add basic chat system
description:
Players can send text messages that everyone sees.
Minimal UI - text box + message display.
